poem:
Title: Flight in the Midst of Earthly Gravity

Karen, once an artist's concept,
Lost, boarded a perpetual jet.
Sky cities painted in transit's sketch,
Unfamiliar passions - fresh, untouched -
Served with morning coffee at sunset's end.
Her sacred truth silenced, now attend,
In flights' mingling of night and day,
The love she discovered along the way.
